identificationModule.briefTitle: Proof of Concept Study Evaluating BP1.3656 in Patients With Fatigue Following Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multisite Randomized Clinical Trial Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of BP1.3656 vs Placebo in Patients With Fatigue Following Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Multicenter, randomized, double blind, parallel-group, placebo-controlled proof of concept study evaluating efficacy and safety of BP1.3656 in patients with fatigue following ischemic stroke.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The placebo tablets will be identical in appearance to the BP1.3656 tablets.

armGroups.label: BP1.3656
armGroups.description: 1 tablet of 30 microgram (µg), 60µg or 90µg of BP1.3656 per day

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: 1 tablet of matching placebo per day

primaryOutcomes.description: 20-item self-report instrument designed to measure fatigue experienced by the participant lately scored from 20 to 100. Higher scores show higher levels of fatigue.

otherOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) as assessed by AEs collection
otherOutcomes.description: Safety assessment of BP1.3656 based on adverse events (AEs) reporting during treatment period.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Systolic blood pressure (BP) measurement
otherOutcomes.description: Safety assessment of BP1.3656 based on the measurement of systolic blood pressure in units of millimeters of mercury (mmHg)

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Diastolic blood pressure (BP) measurement
otherOutcomes.description: Safety assessment of BP1.3656 based on the measurement of Diastolic blood pressure in units of millimeters of mercury (mmHg)
Safety assessment of BP1.3656 based on the measurement of pulse in beats/minute
